name: Chickpea Lentil Quinoa Spinach Stew
description: This chickpea Lentil Quinoa Spinach Stew is easy, filing, full of protein and delicious. Free of dairy, egg, corn, soy, gluten
recipeIngredient: 15 oz can chickpeas or 1.5 cups cooked chickpeas. (safed chana)
1/2 cup red onion (finely chopped or thinly sliced)
2 cups  packed of spinach (add more for greener soup)
1/4 tsp black peppercorns (or add black pepper later)
1/2 tsp raw sugar or other sweetener
pepper flakes (lemon juice, cashews, cheese shreds for garnish)

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and drain the lentils and quinoa and keep ready. Drain the chickpeas and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash and drain the lentils and quinoa and keep ready. Drain the chickpeas and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add oil and onions and green chili and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes. Saute in broth to eliminate oil.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, add oil and onions and green chili and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes. Saute in broth to eliminate oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the spices and mix well and cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the spices and mix well and cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, blend the tomato, spinach, garlic, ginger, peppercorns with 1/2 cup water into a smooth puree.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, blend the tomato, spinach, garlic, ginger, peppercorns with 1/2 cup water into a smooth puree.

recipeInstructions.text: Add to the pan and mix well. Add the lentils, quinoa and chickpeas and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add to the pan and mix well. Add the lentils, quinoa and chickpeas and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt, sugar and 1.5 cups water and cover and cook for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add salt, sugar and 1.5 cups water and cover and cook for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir once in between. Add cashew pieces and mix in, taste and adjust salt and spice. Add water if needed for soupier consistency. Cook for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir once in between. Add cashew pieces and mix in, taste and adjust salt and spice. Add water if needed for soupier consistency. Cook for a few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with red pepper flakes, cheese shreds of choice or cashew cream, crackers, flat bread or rolls.
